userAgreement.section1Content: Welcome to StudyBox. By accessing or using our service, you agree to be bound by the terms and conditions of this User Agreement. If you do not agree to these terms, you must not use our service.
userAgreement.section2Content:
"Service" refers to [Service Name], including but not limited to any related websites, mobile applications, and other platforms operated by [Company Name].



"User" refers to any person or entity accessing or using the Service.



"Content" refers to all information, text, images, videos, and other material provided by the Service or its users.
userAgreement.section3Content: To use the Service, you must be at least [minimum age, typically 13 or 18] years old and have the legal capacity to enter into this Agreement. By using the Service, you represent and warrant that you meet these requirements.
userAgreement.section4Content1: Account Creation: You may be required to create an account to access certain features of the Service. You agree to provide accurate, complete, and up-to-date information during registration.
userAgreement.section4Content2: Account Security: You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials and for all activities that occur under your account. You must notify us immediately of any unauthorized use of your account.
userAgreement.section5Content: Permitted Use: You may use the Service for lawful purposes only. You agree not to use the Service in any way that could harm, disrupt, or impair the functioning of the Service or interfere with other users' enjoyment of it.
userAgreement.section6Content:
Ownership: All intellectual property rights in the Service and its content are owned by [Company Name] or its licensors. You are granted a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable license to use the Service for your personal use.



User Content: By submitting content to the Service, you grant [Company Name] a worldwide, royalty-free, perpetual license to use, modify, reproduce, and distribute your content in connection with the operation of the Service.
userAgreement.section7Content: Your use of the Service is also governed by our Privacy Policy, which can be found at [Privacy Policy URL]. By using the Service, you consent to the collection, use, and sharing of your information as described in the Privacy Policy.
userAgreement.section8Content: We reserve the right to suspend or terminate your access to the Service at any time, without notice, for any reason, including but not limited to violation of this Agreement. Upon termination, your right to use the Service will immediately cease.

listening.title: Practice listening section
listening.subtitle:
The points received will not be displayed

in the overall statistics

rules.title: What’s in the IELTS Academic Listening paper?
rules.text:
The paper has four parts, with ten questions in each part. The questions are in the same order as the information in the recording, so the answer to the first question will be before the answer to the second question, and so on.



Parts 1 and 2 deal with everyday, social situations. There is a conversation between two speakers in Part 1 (for example, a conversation about travel arrangements). Only one person speaks in Part 2 (for example, a speech about local facilities).



Parts 3 and 4 deal with educational and training situations. In Part 3 there is a conversation between two main speakers (for example, two university students in discussion, perhaps guided by a tutor). In Part 4 only one person speaks on an academic subject.



You will hear the recordings once only. Different accents, including British, Australian, New Zealand and North American, are used.



You will need to transfer your answers to an answer sheet. You will have 10 minutes at the end of the test to do this. You should be careful when writing your answers on the answer sheet because you will lose marks for incorrect spelling and grammar.
rules.marking: Each correct answer receives 1 mark. Your final score is given as a band score in whole or half bands, e.g. 5.5 or 7.0.

audioCheck.title: Play the record
audioCheck.subtitle:
You will be listening to an audio clip during this test.

You will not be permitted to pause or rewind the audio while answering the questions.

reading.title: Practice reading section
reading.subtitle:
The points received will not be displayed

in the overall statistics

rules.title: What’s in the IELTS Academic Reading paper?
rules.text: The IELTS Academic Reading paper includes texts from books, journals, magazines, newspapers, and online sources for a non-specialist audience. Topics are of general interest to undergraduate or postgraduate students and may be narrative, descriptive, or argumentative. At least one text contains detailed logical argument and may include diagrams or graphs. Technical vocabulary is explained with simple definitions. Answers must be transferred to the answer sheet within the one-hour test, as no extra time is given. Be careful with spelling and grammar, as mistakes lose marks.
rules.marking: Each correct answer receives 1 mark. Your final score is given as a band score from 1–9 in whole or half bands, e.g. 4 or 6.5.

writing.title: Practice writing section
writing.subtitle:
The points received will not be displayed

in the overall statistics

customize.subtitle: Please select a part of Writing section you want to practice.

rules.title: What’s in the IELTS Academic Writing paper?
rules.text: There are two Writing tasks. In Task 1, you have to describe some visual information in your own words (a graph, table, chart or diagram). You need to write at least 150 words in about 20 minutes. In Task 2, you are given a point of view, argument or problem which you need to discuss. You need to write at least 250 words in about 40 minutes. You must write your answers using full sentences. You must not write your answers as notes or bullet points. You must write your answers on the answer sheet. You are allowed to write notes on the question paper, but these will not be seen by the examiner.
rules.marking: Certificated IELTS examiners assess your performance on each Writing task. There are four assessment criteria (things which the examiner thinks about when deciding what score to give you):

feedback.title: Writing section feedback
feedback.evaluating: Evaluating your answer. It usually takes 1-2 minutes...

followUs.title: Follow us on
followUs.dontMiss: Don't miss the latest IELTS news
followUs.subscribe: Subscribe for exclusive tips, practice resources, exam strategies delivered straight to your inbox

header.desktopOnlyText: For now our service is desktop only

hero.startJourney:
Start Your Journey to IELTS Success

with AI Support Now!
hero.getReadyText: Get ready for the future of IELTS prep with our high-tech platform powered by AI. Our AI carefully looks at your work, gives you helpful feedback, and figures out how good you are at IELTS stuff. No need for old-school teachers anymore — our platform does it all!
hero.unlimitedMockText: Unlimited access to mock exams allows you to practice at your own pace and refine your skills without time constraints or pressure.
hero.practiceBySectionText: By practicing for the IELTS exam by sections, you can effectively target and improve specific skills such as reading, writing, listening, and speaking, leading to overall enhancement in your proficiency.

idiomGenerator.title: Idiom Generator
idiomGenerator.subtitle: Push the button to learn new English idiom

makeYourWay.title: Make your way to the highest score effective and fun

masterIELTS.title: Master IELTS On-the-Go
masterIELTS.subtitle: Study anytime, anywhere, at your own pace

practice.title: Practice makes perfect
practice.subtitle: Consistent practice breeds excellence, mastering IELTS with us isn't rocket science

card1.title:
Follow Your

Personal Road

Map
card1.subtitle: Having a personal study roadmap for IELTS preparation allows you to set clear goals, track progress, and tailor your study plan to your individual strengths and weaknesses.

card2.title: Train on Up-To-Date Tasks
card2.subtitle: By completing up-to-date tasks for the IELTS, you gain familiarity with current test formats and trends, offering a realistic preview of what to expect on exam day.
card2.message1: What are your thoughts on the use of artificial intelligence in everyday life?
card2.message2: Do you think automation will significantly change your job in the future?

card3.title: Track Your Results
card3.subtitle: Results tracking in IELTS practice enables you to monitor your progress, identify areas for improvement, and adjust your study strategies accordingly.

supporting.intro: Share what brings you here so we can meet you where you are.
supporting.goal: Understanding your goal helps us shape the milestones you'll see.
supporting.score: Your target score sets the pace of exercises and mock exams.
supporting.timeline: We'll match reminders and study rhythm to your exam timeframe.
supporting.priority: We’ll surface drills and tips for the sections you highlight.
supporting.finish: Take a breath—your tailored dashboard is ready with next steps.
